content: Singaporean High Level Council The **National Jobs Council** (**NJC**) is a 17-member high-level council aimed at job creation and training. Formed in 2020 by the [Singapore Government](/wiki/Government_of_Singapore), the mission of the National Jobs Council is to identify and develop job opportunities and skills training for Singaporeans during the [COVID-19 pandemic](/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic); it supports the "whole-of-nation approach" to preserve existing jobs and match Singaporeans with job openings. The council is chaired by [Tharman Shanmugaratnam](/wiki/Tharman_Shanmugaratnam). ## History On 26 May 2020, Deputy Prime Minister [Heng Swee Keat](/wiki/Heng_Swee_Keat) announced the plan to set up the National Jobs Council in his fourth Budget. This Singaporean organisation article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: National Jobs Council of Singapore
